title: Meghan Markle's Suits father Wendell Pierce warned her life would be different as royal
text:

Meghan Markle's Suits co-star and on-screen father Wendell Pierce has revealed he warned her that her "life would be very different" as she prepared to marry Prince Harry .

Harry and Meghan tied the knot in May 2018, before welcoming their first child, baby son Archie, a year later.

Meghan left her role as Rachel Zane on the American TV series Suits in season nine, after her engagement was announced to Prince Harry in 2017.

Leaving behind the show and her acting roles for royal duties, Meghan recently spoke out in an ITV documentary with her husband to open up on the struggles she's faced since being in the spotlight - more so since joining the royal family.

(Image: ITV)

Wendell revealed he knew he would have limited contact with the Duchess of Sussex once she started her new life, while revealing what it was he advised her during their last face-to-face conversation before she married Harry.

Speaking on Good Morning Britain on Tuesday, the actor who played Robert Zane on Suits explained he told her life would be "very different".

He said: "I just remember the last moment I had with her… which I even told her your life is going to be very different, but in those tough times just remember you have a lot of people who care about you.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images)

"And that you know, protocol, we’re probably not going to be in touch with each other as much as you think but just know you have a friend in me and that there will be a lot of people who care about you.”

On the negativity, he continued: “In those darkest hours, I hope she knows how much she is loved.

"I hope she knows how many people, millions of people care for her. I’m sure that her mother raised her well, so prepared her for the ugly side of human nature like any woman of colour would teach their child, just like my parents taught me.

(Image: ITV)

"There are going to be people out there who do not have your best interests at heart but those are not the people you focus on, you focus away from them.”

After watching the documentary himself, Wendell shared his support for Meghan adding: "I'm her TV dad!"

Wendell makes his own TV return as he stars in the second season of Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan which has recently launched in the UK on Amazon Prime.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
description: Suits star Wendell Pierce, who played Meghan Markle's on-screen dad, recalled his last conversation with her before her wedding to Prince Harry
